attributes.action: support Radio Caroline and the radio-ship Ross Revenge by way of an exemption or amendement to the Marine and Broadcasting offences act (1967) in order to facilitate the return of Radio Caroline and the Ross Revenge to the high-seas as a legal offshore European broadcaster.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Radio Caroline first broadcast on Easter Sunday 1964 and has provided musical entertainment for millions of British and European listeners over 4 decades. On August the 19th, 1989, the radio ship MV Ross Revenge was boarded by Dutch officials and officials of the British Department of Trade and Industry. Radio Caroline was taken off air to the dismay of millions. As we approach the 20th anniversary of that raid it is time that the special status of Radio Caroline as a European broadcaster were recognised by the British Government.
